description:
About Airalo
Alo! Airalo is the world‚Äôs first eSIM store that helps people connect in over 200+ countries and regions across the globe. We are building the next digital service that revolutionizes the telecom industry. We are a travel-tech company and an equal-opportunity environment that values and executes diversity, inclusion, and equity. Our team is spread across 50+ countries and six continents. What glues us together is our commitment to changing the way you connect.

About you
We hope that you care deeply about the quality of your work, the intrinsic worth of tasks, and the success of your team. You are self-disciplined and do not require micromanagement in terms of your skillset and work ethic. You do your best to flourish as an individual every day while working hard to foster a collaborative team environment. You believe in the importance of being ‚Äî and staying ‚Äî authentic, honest, positive, and kind. You are a good interlocutor with clear and concise communication. You are able to manage multiple projects, have an analytical mind, pay keen attention to detail, and love to get your hands dirty. You are cognizant, tolerant, and welcoming of vulnerabilities and cultural differences.

About the Role
Position: Full-time / Employee
Location: Remote-first
Benefits: Health Insurance, work-from-anywhere stipend, annual wellness & learning credits, annual all-expenses-paid company retreat in a gorgeous destination & other benefits

The Senior IT Operations Systems Engineer is pivotal in helping shape the future of how our Internal Users work. The systems engineer will have a big role in building out automation within the IT organization and will be a POC/escalation point for the IT operations team. With this role being the first of its kind at Airalo, You will be responsible for helping with building out structures and processes for the team, having an eye for continuous process improvement, and always looking for ways to improve our internal user experience. If you enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, possess strong interpersonal skills, and have a passion for technology and telecommunications, we encourage you to explore further.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Identify and solve team, organizational, and business IT infrastructure problems.
  • Making technical decisions on behalf of the department and organization while providing presentation support to leaders during technical discussions.
  • Joint collaboration with Compliance, IT, People, and Security team members for improving automation efficiency, security posture, and vulnerability management.
  • Designing and developing software that improves back office automation.
  • Participate in the Global IT planning process and ensure architectural designs and principles are incorporated in enterprise implementations
  • Provide senior level direction to the Information Technology team, assist with mentoring and providing technical guidance to more junior staff members
  • Build roadmaps for acquiring, integrating, and implementing high-value technology and processes. Oversee efforts (e.g. proof of concepts) to measure and prove new technology value
  • Create and manage access policies to improve security and adhere to compliance standards.
  • Build and maintain cross-functional relationships with internal teams to drive initiatives
  • Work with Security, PeopleOps and IT to develop automated onboarding and offboarding processes

  • 5+ years of experience in user support in a cloud-first modern IT environment
  • Proven experience designing and deploying SaaS applications such as MDM and IDP Solutions
  • In-depth knowledge of identity and access management concepts and practices.
  • Developing automation workflows and integrations for repetitive or manual tasks
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Team player and open to new ideas.
  • Good communication skills and fluency in English.
    • ,

  • Knowledge in one of the following scripting languages - Python or Ruby

description:

Vous pouvez retrouver toutes nos offres d'emploi sur cette page, ainsi que plus d'informations sur Didask, notre culture et nos avantages.

üá¨üáßüá∫üá∏ While English is our working language at Didask and proficiency is required to join us, we publish all our job openings in both English and French. You can find all our positions on this page, along with more information about Didask, our culture and benefits.

Job description

Note: we describe our ideal candidate below. For an exceptional profile, this role could evolve into a Chief Financial Officer position. Please feel free to apply even if you don't think you match all items ‚Äî we know these are ambitious expectations!

As Head of Finance & Corporate at Didask, you'll play a pivotal role in our next phase of growth. With over 65 team members today and plans to reach 100+ in the coming year, we're looking for someone to build and lead world-class finance and corporate functions while preserving the agility and transparency that make our culture unique.

This role embodies our values of distributed ownership, radical transparency, and data-driven decision making:

Financial Leadership

- Own our entire financial strategy, from daily operations to long-term planning

- Build and maintain transparent financial models that drive decision-making across the company

- Optimize cash management and financial operations at scale

- Lead non-dilutive fundraising initiatives (debt, public funding, grants)

- Lead relationships with investors, banks, and auditors with our signature transparency

- Structure and manage our equity programs (BSA/BSPCE) to share our success

Corporate Leadership

- Lead all legal and compliance matters, from contracts to corporate governance

- Oversee and optimize our administrative operations

- Manage our workplace strategy and facilities

- Build and maintain relationships with key external partners (law firms, accounting firms)

- Ensure our corporate structure supports our growth while staying lean and efficient

Strategic Impact

- Partner with leadership to align financial and corporate strategy with company objectives

- Champion data-driven decision making across the organization

- Build scalable foundations that support both growth and cultural values

- Be a key voice in strategic discussions, bringing both financial insight and cultural awareness

- Embody and strengthen our culture of radical transparency in all matters

Team Building

- Define and execute the long-term vision for the Finance & Corporate team

- Identify and attract key talent as we scale

- Mentor and develop team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning

- Create opportunities for internal growth and skill development

- Build a team that embodies our values of transparency and distributed ownership

Your profile

We're looking for someone with both strong financial expertise and a deep commitment to building transparent, scalable organizations. Here's what we expect:

  • Financial Excellence: You have significant experience in B2B SaaS startups, with a deep understanding of French accounting and tax regulations. You've built financial processes from the ground up, and your experience includes both equity and non-dilutive fundraising.

  • Business Acumen: Beyond pure finance, you understand B2B SaaS metrics and what drives business value. You have experience with pricing strategies, unit economics, and translating business objectives into financial planning.

  • Legal & Corporate: You have a solid understanding of French corporate law and governance. You're experienced in managing legal matters in a high-growth environment and comfortable working with external counsel.

  • Ownership Mindset: You thrive in environments where ownership is distributed and initiative is valued over hierarchy. You're comfortable making decisions with imperfect information and taking responsibility for outcomes. You believe in empowering teams through transparency rather than controlling through process.

  • Communication Master: Written communication is at the heart of our culture, and you excel at it. You can make complex financial concepts accessible to non-finance stakeholders and practice radical transparency in your communications. You build trust through clear, thoughtful documentation and embrace async-first collaboration.

  • Strategic & Hands-on: You combine big-picture thinking with a willingness to dive into the details. You're equally comfortable building financial models and optimizing day-to-day operations. You know when to delegate and when to roll up your sleeves, always keeping our mission and values in mind.

  • Growth Mindset: You're passionate about continuous learning and developing others. You see challenges as opportunities for growth and actively seek feedback. You have experience mentoring team members and creating learning opportunities.

  • Tech Savvy: While not technical, you're comfortable with modern tools and excited about using technology to automate and scale operations. You have a track record of selecting and implementing tools that drive efficiency.

Interview process

Apply by answering a few written questions about your vision and expertise. Use your own words - we value authentic communication.

If your profile catches our attention, here's what to expect:

  • Screening Interview: A first conversation to understand your background and motivations. We'll discuss your experience with transparent organizations and distributed ownership, and how you approach building scalable finance and corporate operations.

  • Take-home Exercise: A practical challenge combining financial modeling and strategic thinking. We assess both technical skills and communication clarity, with emphasis on documentation and transparency.

  • Leadership Discussion: A deeper conversation about scaling finance and corporate operations with key stakeholders. We'll explore your vision for the role and discuss concrete collaboration scenarios.

  • Final Conversation: A discussion with cofounders about vision, values, and culture. We'll align on expectations and explore how you see the future of finance and corporate functions at Didask.

title: Client Communications Coordinator
description:
Join a rapidly growing advertising agency, where we focus on helping clients succeed on the Amazon advertising platform. Be at the forefront of our client relations team and lead the way to success with your outstanding organizational and communication skills.

Your Mission: Day to Day Responsibilities

As a Client Communications Coordinator, you'll be the primary point of contact for a subset of our clients. Your day-to-day responsibilities include:

  • Manage client communications, ensuring timely and professional responses.
  • Serve as a liaison between clients and PPC Account Managers, ensuring account objectives are met.
  • Prepare for and conduct biweekly or monthly client calls, delivering performance reports and actionable insights.
  • Track and analyze advertising performance, providing clear explanations to clients.
  • Hold PPC Account Managers accountable for delivering client goals.
  • Report directly to the COO, sharing progress, challenges, and client updates.
  • Keep current information up-to-date in our knowledge base and team tools.

Your Toolbox: Skills to be Successful

To thrive in this remote role, you should have:

  • Organization: Ability to manage your own time and delegate when necessary, with a focus on accountability and task follow-through.
  • Communication: Exceptional skills in client relationship management and team collaboration.
  • Creativity: Proactive in discovering innovative ways to delight our clients.

title: Administrative & Team Culture Specialist
description:
ADMINISTRATIVE & TEAM CULTURE SPECIALIST, PRODUCT & TECHNOLOGY DEPARTMENT

Summary

The Administrative & Team Culture Specialist - Product & Technology Department will support the Wikimedia Foundation Product & Technology Department in facilitating and fostering a connected team culture, ensuring that intra- and extra- department communications are clear and aligned and providing the Chief Product & Technology Officer and Product & Technology Vice Presidents with daily administrative support.¬†¬†

Reporting to the Chief Product & Technology Officer (CPTO), you will be responsible for managing the calendar of the CPTO and two VPs, working with others within the organization to manage complex calendaring requests across many time zones. Additionally, this role will be responsible for coordinating and leading the weekly Office of CPTO meeting, note-taking and supporting special projects. You will also lead our department culture-building; designing impactful virtual and in-person activities that are thoughtfully coordinated and executed within budget. Last, this role will provide foundational communication support needed to increase collaboration and transparency within the P&T Department and between P&T Department staff and other WMF staff.¬† On average, this role will require travel 2-4 times per year.

You are responsible for:

  • Provide the Chief Product & Technology Officer with regular administrative support, including calendaring and expense management
  • Provide two (2) Vice Presidents with calendar management¬†
  • Develop agendas for all-department meetings and create and disseminate all-department communications
  • Partner with the internal Admin team for scheduling logistics related to cross-team projects and department gatherings
  • Coordinate venue, location and activity planning for team and department events
  • Understanding procurement and contract processes, including but not limited to booking event speakers

Skills and Experience:

  • Deep attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy
  • Experience consistently producing high-quality work, managing multiple tasks, and executing under deadlines, occasionally during high-pressure situations
  • Proven track record of handling confidential/sensitive information with grace and care
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Experience in managing projects using Asana or similar project management and progress tracking tools
  • Experience creating clear and realistic timelines, tracking progress and helping others stick to deadlines, always considering the dynamic and flexibility of the process
  • Understanding of best practices for cultural inclusivity to ensure culture-building activities reflects multiple perspectives
  • Ability to establish clear metrics for participation and engagement across multiple teams
  • Ability to craft strategic and creative messages, with experience in writing compelling emails, Slack messages and newsletters
  • Ability to edit a range of voices and styles for diverse audience

Additionally, we‚Äôd love it if you have:

  • Experience working with organizations both inside and outside the U.S.
  • Experience working in the non-profit sector and/or a tech-focused organization
  • Interest in learning more about the different aspects of product and engineering work
  • Enthusiastic about finding ways to add culture-building and connection opportunities and/or creative touches to your work
  • General understanding of the existing landscape of the Wikimedia movement
  • Passion for our mission to share free knowledge with the world
About the Wikimedia Foundation

The Wikimedia Foundation is the nonprofit organization that operates Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge freely. We host Wikipedia and the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive.¬†

The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive donations from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

As an equal opportunity employer, the Wikimedia Foundation values having a diverse workforce and continuously strives to maintain an inclusive and equitable workplace. We encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply. We do not discriminate against any person based upon their race, traits historically associated with race, religion, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy or related medical conditions, parental status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristics.

The Wikimedia Foundation is a remote-first organization with staff members including contractors based 40+ countries*. Salaries at the Wikimedia Foundation are set in a way that is competitive, equitable, and consistent with our values and culture. The anticipated annual pay range of this position for applicants based within the United States is US$75,893¬†to US$99,172 with multiple individualized factors, including cost of living in the location, being the determinants of the offered pay. For applicants located outside of the US, the pay range will be adjusted to the country of hire. We neither ask for nor take into consideration the salary history of applicants. The compensation for a successful applicant will be based on their skills, experience and location.¬†

*Please note that we are currently able to hire in the following countries: Australia, Austria, Bangladesh, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, Colombia, Costa Rica, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Egypt, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Ghana, Greece, India, Indonesia, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Kenya, Mexico, Netherlands, Nigeria, Peru, Poland, Singapore, South Africa, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Uganda, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States of America and Uruguay.¬† Our non-US employees are hired through a local third party Employer of Record (EOR).¬†

We periodically review this list to streamline to ensure alignment with our hiring requirements.¬†

All applicants can reach out to their recruiter to understand more about the specific pay range for their location during the interview process.

If you are a qualified applicant requiring assistance or an accommodation to complete any step of the application process due to a disability, you may contact us at recruiting@wikimedia.org or +1 (415) 839-6885.
